summary: This document is a detailed log of activity observed on surveillance video at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) from 4:00 PM on August 9, 2019, to 7:00 AM on August 10, 2019. It meticulously records the movements of officers, inmates, and other personnel around the Special Housing Unit (SHU), specifically noting access to Door 46 (an entrance to cellblock 10 South), general cleaning activities, and routine counts. The log was created in the context of the investigation into Jeffrey Epstein's death in custody.

persons.name: Officer Noel
persons.context: A correctional officer frequently mentioned moving throughout the Multi-Purpose area, escorting inmates, and accessing Door 46 and various tiers (G, H, J, L). The log speculates on her identity in several entries.

persons.name: Officer Thomas
persons.context: Mentioned once as a person possibly wearing a dark hoodie who accessed Door 46 around 5:37 AM on August 10, 2019.

persons.name: Lt. 1=1
persons.context: Cited in a parenthetical note stating that Door 46 is a way to get to cellblock 10 South from the Special Housing Unit (SHU).

events.title: Surveillance Period at MCC SHU
events.description: Continuous video surveillance log of activity in and around the Special Housing Unit's Multi-Purpose area, desk area, and cellblock tiers (G, H, J, K, L, M). The log records movements of officers and inmates, cleaning activities, access to Door 46, and routine inmate counts.

events.title: Access to Door 46
events.description: Multiple instances of personnel (Black Male, Black Female, Officer Noel, a lighter-skinned female, Officer Thomas) using a phone to unlock and enter Door 46, which is noted as an entrance to cellblock 10 South.

events.title: Cleaning and Janitorial Activity
events.description: Inmates and officers are observed engaged in extensive cleaning activities throughout the Multi-Purpose area and cellblock tiers, involving carts, silver containers, and trash bags.

events.title: Inmate Counts
events.description: Around 9:10 PM, the log speculates that increased officer movement with papers may indicate the start of the 10:00 PM inmate count, with officers moving to L, M, J, H, and K Tiers.

locations: Cellblock Tiers: G Tier, H Tier, J Tier, K Tier, L Tier, M Tier
keyFacts: The log documents a 15-hour period of surveillance video from the MCC SHU on the night of August 9-10, 2019, surrounding Jeffrey Epstein's death.
Door 46 is explicitly identified as an access point to cellblock 10 South, where Epstein was housed.
The log shows frequent access to Door 46 by various personnel, including officers and other staff, throughout the night and early morning.
Activity includes routine operations like inmate cleaning details, officer patrols, and inmate counts, providing a baseline of normal activity.
Specific officers, including Officer Noel and a possible Officer Thomas, are identified as being present and active during the surveillance period.
